newsitem.title: CANADA: St. Lawrence Seaway cargo volume up two pct vs '95.
newsitem.headline: St. Lawrence Seaway cargo volume up two pct vs '95.

text.p: Cargo volume transitting the St. Lawrence Seaway by the end of November was two percent higher compared to the same period last year, the St. Lawrence Seaway Authority said in a statement.
"Given sustained favourable weather conditions, traffic on the St. Lawrence Seaway system is expected to remain strong for the remainder of the season," Authority president Glendon Stewart said.
A total of 45,558,446 tonnes passed through the Seaway by Nov 30 compared to 44,697,198 tonnes by Nov 30, 1995.
Toll revenue was C$2 million higher than last year.
Vessel transits to Nov 30 totalled 3,463 compared to 3,566 in the same period last year, the statement said.
